alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Cape May; Cumberland (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 7:53PM EDT until April 01 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ATLANTIC...CUMBERLAND AND NORTHWESTERN CAPE MAY COUNTIES... At 753 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Weymouth to near Dorothy to near Bivalve, moving east at 45 mph. This storm recently produced a 58 mph wind gust at Millville. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Millville, Cumberland, Buena, Laurel Lake, Weymouth, Estell Manor, Corbin City, Newport, Leesburg, Dorothy, Bricksboro, Fortesque, Eldora, Mauricetown, Belleplain Forest, Mays Landing, Port Norris, Dividing Creek and Fairton. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 11 and 19. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southern New Jersey. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
